snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu  suggested the threats Israel faces justified the handling of an Australian-Israeli who was held under a pseudonym in a maximum-security prison until he committed suicide in 2010.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu defends his government's handling of Australian-Israeli Ben Zygier, known as Prisoner X, who was held for months in maximum-security prison until he committed suicide in 2010; Netanyahu suggests that threats Israel faces justify extraordinary measures and secrecy surrounding case.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu  suggested the threats Israel faces justified the handling of an Australian-Israeli who was held under a pseudonym in a maximum-security prison until he committed suicide in 2010.

headline.seo: Netanyahu Defends Israel’s Handling of Prisoner X Case
headline.main: Netanyahu Defends Handling of Prisoner X
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Defends Handling Of Prisoner X
